Talon:

talon smiled and nodde. But inside she was worried, she retreat at =
her quarters while her little babies slept. They were together as if they w=
ere seeking protect each other.

Talon walked towards her quarters, she nee=
ded to craft a proper crib. She left her babies in the bed and starte to wo=
rk

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>=

> Tucson heaves a sigh.  
> 
> " I meant to call Rodimus, Perceptor, Rattr=
ap and Windlord back to the ark in an alternate fashion rather than the con=
 link.  I'm sensing another interruption in our communications system.  I a=
pologize if I've startled any of you close by.  Still no word from them..  =
Surely they would have heard that. "
> 
> He was now very concerned for the=
 welfare of Rodimus, Windlord, Perceptor and Rattrap.  He gives Talon the b=
abies once more and gets back into beast mode.
> 
> " Leo, watch over opera=
tions while I'm gone.  Lord Elder, inform me at once if you hear anything p=
ertaining to Rodimus and the others.  I know where I must go, but do not kn=
ow what I will find. "
> 
> He gives Talon a gentile rub on her face with h=
is snout and does the same for his babies.
> 
> " Stay strong for me, I wil=
l return as soon as I can.  That's a promise."
> 
> He now walks out with a=
 stern stride and extends his wings, lifting himself off the ground, stirri=
ng up debris in mini cyclones around him as he takes flight.  His armor shi=
mmers brilliantly as it catches the light of the sky, appearing almost like=
 lightning as his long tail trails behind him.
> 
> Once in the air, he giv=
es another beacon roar, even louder than the first, to see if Rodimus and t=
he others can hear him.  This intern sounds just like a boom of thunder whi=
ch has a habit of rattling the ground somewhat.  Yes there be a dragon soar=
ing over the skies as Tucsons shadow is cast over the entrance of the cave =
where the Enemy was last seen.  Another booming roar confirms his arrival a=
s he circles the area.
